snippet: The lead Palestinian negotiator said the talks would end if Israel did not withdraw its call for new plans for housing in West Bank settlements.
abstract: Troubled Middle East peace talks threaten to collapse over what the Israeli government describes as a routine bureaucratic move by its housing ministry to start long-term planning for 20,000 new apartments in West Bank settlements; Saeb Erekat, lead Palestinian negotiator, says that the group will terminate negotiations if Israel does not withdraw call for the new housing plans.

byline.contributor: Michael D. Shear contributed reporting from Washington, and Isabel Kershner from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: The lead Palestinian negotiator said the talks would end if Israel did not withdraw its call for new plans for housing in West Bank settlements.

headline.main: Israeli Move Over Housing Poses a Threat to Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Israeli Move Over Housing Poses a Threat To Peace Talks
